text:
Gully Boy has turned out to be a phenomenally shot film of 2019. After Vicky Kaushal's Uri, audience is going gaga over Ranveer Singh's latest film. The movie that is based on underground Indian rappers has shown their music in an all new light.
youtube/screengrab
Paying a tribute to famous rappers Divine and Naezy, the movie shows the life of people staying in slums and how they rise above it all to become successful. As per trade analyst, Taran Adarsh, the movie has so far raked in Rs 95 crore in India and is working well in the overseas market.
#GullyBoy is having an incredible run #Overseas... Has crossed $ 3 million in USA+Canada, while #Overseas total till Tue [19 Feb 2019] is approx $ 6 million [₹ 42.70 cr]... Breakup:
USA+Canada: $ 3 mn
UAE+GCC: $ 1.231 mn
UK: $ 430k
Australia: A$ 542k — taran adarsh (@taran_adarsh) February 20, 2019
Not only aam janta but celebrities are also raving about the performances in the film. And that does not include Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt but Siddhant Chaturvedi, Vijay Raaz and Vijay Varma.
Don't Miss 862 SHARES 346 SHARES 183 SHARES
Twitter
Ishaan Khatter loved the movie so much that he decided to turn into a rapper himself. Uploading the coolest rap on Instagram, Ishaan enjoyed Moeen aka Vijay Varma's role and dedicate the video to him. Take a look.
"Moeen bhai bole machao toh majboori thi, kya? In honour of one of my favourite films in a long time and Moeen bhai, one of @zoieakhtar ’s best characters. Thank you @itsvijayvarma for making him a flesh and blood human being," his caption said.
Maybe we can see Ishaan in a sequel of Gully Boy. What do you think?
title: After Ranveer Singh, Ishaan Khatter Turns Rapper To Pay A Tribute To Gully Boy's Moeen
